story:
Once upon a time in the magical land of Japan, there lived a brave and curious young boy named Haruki. Haruki loved to explore the forests and mountains near his home, always seeking out new adventures and mysteries to uncover.

One day, as Haruki wandered deep into the forest, he stumbled upon a hidden path he had never seen before. Intrigued, he decided to follow it, winding his way through the dense trees and bushes. As the sun began to set, Haruki realized he had wandered farther than he had ever been before.

Just as he was starting to feel a little scared and lost, Haruki saw a soft light twinkling in the distance. Curious, he followed the light until he reached a clearing where he found a beautiful lantern glowing with a warm, gentle light.

Beside the lantern stood a wise old fox, who smiled at Haruki and said, "Young one, you have ventured far and wide, but know that you are never truly lost as long as you follow your heart."

The fox led Haruki back home through the forest, guiding him safely back to his loving family. From that day on, Haruki always remembered the fox's words and knew that as long as he listened to his heart, he would never be lost.

And so, Haruki drifted off to sleep that night, dreaming of the adventures and mysteries that awaited him in the magical land of Japan.

The end. Goodnight, little one. Sweet dreams.
